commit_message:
Use a jinja block to reduce str_replace repetition

It would appear that we use the same str_replace params most
of the time, and there's no harm in using aliases where only
some of them are used. This way we reduce the maintenance
burden because we only need to maintain it in one place.

Change-Id: Ib034405a15ade9e9fb234a9875ebbe922abfdfc6

subject: [update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-24 11:07:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/db8bbb0541a2ee5e3991611346807687dca0c048', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-02-24 17:51:29.000000000', 'files': ['common/deploy-steps.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3040a61411d70aa7802f8adbc0a75fb0396b6bf1', 'message': '[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c
'}]
commit_message:
[update/upgrade] Use include_tasks instead of import_tasks

include_tasks is dynamic and the tasks are either included (or not) at
runtime. This has the advantage that if a "when" keyword excludes the
include_tasks, then all the tasks are excluded as a group.

This is opposed to import_tasks which happen at playbook parse time. The
"when" keyword is inherited by each individual task that was imported.

While the two are functionally equivalent for these use cases,
import_tasks ends up being much slower, since ansible then has to
compute a much larger set of tasks to skip at runtime. Using
include_tasks is much faster, even at small scale (~50 hosts).

This is applying what was done in https://review.opendev.org/697510
to the update/upgrade tasks.

When doing include_tasks, we ensure that we also apply the 'always' tag
so that we have access to use the tags in the included task files. See
[a] for further details.

[a] https://odyssey4.me/2019/11/26/ansible-include-tags.html

Change-Id: I2eab008ca27546acbd2b1275f07bcca0b84b858c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-07 14:15:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/4bd1bf6428ca885d45e041a015dcf2f77215d919', 'message': 'Do not use tests as filters

Using tests as filters is deprecated and will be removed in Ansible

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2020-03-09 14:33:55.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/b072b6e3abc49474e943daad2fe8df6ab22ef5d7', 'message': 'Do not use tests as filters

Change-Id: I940f522f87a42e20ee594be897b1f6853cef13e4
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use tests as filters

Using tests as filters is deprecated and will be removed in Ansible
version 2.9 so this change changes "result|search" to "result is search"
as recommended in the warning message.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711904/

Change-Id: I940f522f87a42e20ee594be897b1f6853cef13e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/15/711815/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: when: ansible_os_family | search("openSUSE Tumbleweed") when: (ansible_os_family | search("SUSE LINUX")) or (ansible_os_family | search("openSUSE Leap"))

commit_message:
module metalsmith_instances

A module which performs reservation, provision and unprovision of a
multiple ironic node instances. The only package it imports is
metalsmith, to allow for the possible future option of putting it in
the metalsmith repo.

Change-Id: Ib6c7739d27c0fb5d937ce31c82c5c0bba86b5f41
Story: 2007212
Task: 38457

commit_message:
Change the default for octavia-worker workers to os_workers

Previously this was set to os_service_default but should use the
os_workers fact

Change-Id: Id26f6c1c252121f543938305098d22f6510299e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-octavia refs/changes/22/711122/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_expected.to contain_octavia_config('controller_worker/workers').with_value(facts[:os_workers])

commit_message:
Prepare to switch CentOS 8 job voting again

Fixing things in scripts and playbooks in preparation of
making CentOS 8 tinyipa job vote again.

- python packages are not defined anymore
- change yum to dnf when needed
- change python2 packages to equal python3 when possible
- ipxe binary has changed to ipxe-x86_64.efi

Change-Id: I89989b6d2e35f0291ba1c1aed8b3317cfe2d691d

commit_message:
Ignore Not Found when deleting Keystone role assignment

If the project has already been deleted, don't let that prevent role
assignments on it from being deleted.

Change-Id: I56aede8209e425ee6c2d762a44db8cda5416e69b
Task: 30955
(cherry picked from commit 8c67437378ca505c5752cee0d862d806ca11c3a0)

commit_message:
Run vbmcd as a Systemd service

Virtualbmc 2.0 dropped the daemon autostart feature. This means we need
to explicitly start it. Running it as a Systemd unit, code adapted from
Tenks.

In order to allow Systemd to execute the daemon on systems with SELinux
enabled, it must be installed to the system rather than a virtualenv.

Change-Id: I66e8e5f5a9c16ac90e132074c826d508458ae4d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/04/711904/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [Unit] Description=Virtual BMC daemon [Service] Type=simple Restart=on-failure ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/vbmcd --foreground

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/88/684788/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # Copyright (c) 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # Copyright (c) 2013, Benno Joy <benno@ansible.com> # GNU General Public License v3.0+ (see COPYING or https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt) from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function __metaclass__ = type ANSIBLE_METADATA = {'metadata_version': '1.1', 'status': ['preview'], 'supported_by': 'community'} DOCUMENTATION = ''' --- module: os_object short_description: Create or Delete objects and containers from OpenStack version_added: "2.0" author: "Monty Taylor (@emonty)" extends_documentation_fragment: openstack description: - Create or Delete objects and containers from OpenStack options: container: description: - The name of the container in which to create the object required: true name: description: - Name to be give to the object. If omitted, operations will be on the entire container required: false filename: description: - Path to local file to be uploaded. required: false container_access: description: - desired container access level. required: false choices: ['private', 'public'] default: private state: description: - Should the resource be present or absent. choices: [present, absent] default: present availability_zone: description: - Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility required: false ''' EXAMPLES = ''' - name: "Create a object named 'fstab' in the 'config' container" os_object: cloud: mordred state: present name: fstab container: config filename: /etc/fstab - name: Delete a container called config and all of its contents os_object: cloud: rax-iad state: absent container: config ''' from ansible.module_utils.basic import AnsibleModule from ansible_collections.openstack.cloud.plugins.module_utils.openstack import openstack_full_argument_spec, openstack_module_kwargs, openstack_cloud_from_module def process_object( cloud_obj, container, name, filename, container_access, **kwargs): changed = False container_obj = cloud_obj.get_container(container) if kwargs['state'] == 'present': if not container_obj: container_obj = cloud_obj.create_container(container) changed = True if cloud_obj.get_container_access(container) != container_access: cloud_obj.set_container_access(container, container_access) changed = True if name: if cloud_obj.is_object_stale(container, name, filename): cloud_obj.create_object(container, name, filename) changed = True else: if container_obj: if name: if cloud_obj.get_object_metadata(container, name): cloud_obj.delete_object(container, name) changed = True else: cloud_obj.delete_container(container) changed = True return changed def main(): argument_spec = openstack_full_argument_spec( name=dict(required=False, default=None), container=dict(required=True), filename=dict(required=False, default=None), container_access=dict(default='private', choices=['private', 'public']), state=dict(default='present', choices=['absent', 'present']), ) module_kwargs = openstack_module_kwargs() module = AnsibleModule(argument_spec, **module_kwargs) sdk, cloud = openstack_cloud_from_module(module) try: changed = process_object(cloud, **module.params) module.exit_json(changed=changed) except sdk.exceptions.OpenStackCloudException as e: module.fail_json(msg=str(e)) if __name__ == "__main__": main()

commit_message:
Add tox.ini file for running pep8

We don't need some of the openstack constructs, like constraints,
since this doesn't co-install.

Change-Id: I1217e055fd6230e01c8e552cd1a1a63a5ee9a0d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack refs/changes/56/698056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [tox] minversion = 3.1 envlist = pep8 skipsdist = True ignore_basepython_conflict = True [testenv] skip_install = True install_command = pip install {opts} {packages} passenv = OS_* setenv = VIRTUAL_ENV={envdir} LANG=en_US.UTF-8 LANGUAGE=en_US:en LC_ALL=C OS_LOG_CAPTURE={env:OS_LOG_CAPTURE:true} OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE={env:OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE:true} OS_STDERR_CAPTURE={env:OS_STDERR_CAPTURE:true} deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt commands = stestr run {posargs} stestr slowest [testenv:pep8] commands = flake8 [testenv:venv] deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt commands = {posargs} [flake8] # W503 Is supposed to be off by default but in the latest pycodestyle isn't. # Also, both openstacksdk and Donald Knuth disagree with the rule. Line # breaks should occur before the binary operator for readability. # H4 are rules for docstrings. Maybe we should clean them? # E501,E402,H301,H236,F401,E128,F841 are ignored so we can import the existing # modules unchanged and then clean them in subsequent patches. ignore = W503,H4,E501,E402,H301,H236,F401,E128,F841 show-source = True exclude=.venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*lib/python*,*egg,build

commit_message:
[monasca] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Iaba89b552b7d7490c7ee545f5ef6cf13a659dc4a

commit_message:
Add Certmonger ceph_rgw class to config tls

This patch adds the ceph_rgw class required by certmonger to
create the cert/key.
This patch also creates the service_pem file since the rgw
container private key, public certificate and any other CA or
intermediate certificates should be in one file, in PEM format.

Change-Id: I960f7c48866ef11e58e63d80217f7df660455fe1

added_lines: # Copyright 2019 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::certmonger::ceph_grafana # # Request a certificate for RabbitMQ and do the necessary setup. # # === Parameters # # [*hostname*] # The hostname of the node. this will be set in the CN of the certificate. # # [*service_certificate*] # The path to the certificate that will be used for TLS in this service. # # [*service_key*] # The path to the key that will be used for TLS in this service. # # [*certmonger_ca*] # (Optional) The CA that certmonger will use to generate the certificates. # Defaults to hiera('certmonger_ca', 'local'). # # [*postsave_cmd*] # (Optional) Specifies the command to execute after requesting a certificate. # Defaults to undef. # # [*principal*] # (Optional) The service principal that is set for the service in kerberos. # Defaults to undef # class tripleo::certmonger::ceph_rgw ( $hostname, $service_certificate, $service_key, $service_pem, $postsave_cmd = undef, $certmonger_ca = hiera('certmonger_ca', 'local'), $principal = undef, ) { ensure_resource('file', '/usr/bin/certmonger-rgw-refresh.sh', { source => 'puppet:///modules/tripleo/certmonger-rgw-refresh.sh', mode => '0700', seltype => 'bin_t', notify => Service['certmonger'] }) certmonger_certificate { 'ceph_rgw' : ensure => 'present', certfile => $service_certificate, keyfile => $service_key, hostname => $hostname, dnsname => $hostname, principal => $principal, postsave_cmd => $postsave_cmd, ca => $certmonger_ca, wait => true, require => Class['::certmonger'], } #file { $service_certificate : # require => Certmonger_certificate['ceph_rgw'], # owner => 472, # group => 472, #} #file { $service_key : # require => Certmonger_certificate['ceph_rgw'], # owner => 472, # group => 472, #} concat { $service_pem : ensure => present, mode => '0640', owner => 472, group => 472, tag => 'ceph-rgw-cert', } Package<| name == $::ceph_rgw::params::package_name |> -> Concat[$service_pem] concat::fragment { "${title}-cert-fragment": target => $service_pem, source => $service_certificate, order => '01', tag => 'ceph_rgw-cert', require => Certmonger_certificate["${title}-cert"], } if $certmonger_ca == 'local' { $ca_pem = getparam(Class['tripleo::certmonger::ca::local'], 'ca_pem') concat::fragment { "${title}-ca-fragment": target => $service_pem, source => $ca_pem, order => '10', tag => 'ceph_rgw-cert', require => Class['tripleo::certmonger::ca::local'], } } elsif $certmonger_ca == 'IPA' { concat::fragment { "${title}-ca-fragment": target => $service_pem, source => '/etc/ipa/ca.crt', order => '10', tag => 'ceph_rgw-cert', } } concat::fragment { "${title}-key-fragment": target => $service_pem, source => $service_key, order => 20, tag => 'ceph_rgw-cert', require => Certmonger_certificate["${title}-cert"], } }

commit_message:
[ironic] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: I9520c1504bb944718070ef4124a95f38352920e6

tests: Convert 'OpenStackAuthTestsV3Base' to mock (pt. 3)

Change-Id: Id937a57cc0ca2d9f0f905048d990ac7646d37c1b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

added_lines: class OpenStackAuthTestsV3WithMock2(OpenStackAuthTestsV3Base): USE_MOX = False @mock.patch.object(v3_auth, 'Keystone2Keystone') @mock.patch.object(client_v3, 'Client') @mock.patch.object(v3_auth, 'Token') @mock.patch.object(v3_auth, 'Password') def test_switch_keystone_provider_remote( self, mock_password, mock_token, mock_client, mock_k2k, ): sp_projects = [self.sp_data.project_one, self.sp_data.project_two] mock_password.return_value.get_access.return_value = \ self.data.unscoped_access_info mock_password.return_value.auth_url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL mock_token.return_value.get_access.side_effect = [ self.data.domain_scoped_access_info, self.data.unscoped_access_info, self.data.unscoped_access_info, settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, self.sp_data.federated_unscoped_access_info, self.sp_data.federated_unscoped_access_info, ] mock_token.return_value.get_sp_auth_url.return_value = \ 'https://k2kserviceprovider/sp_url' mock_token.return_value.auth_url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL mock_client.return_value.projects.list.return_value = projects mock_client.return_value.auth.domains.return_value = domains mock_client.return_value.federation.projects.list.return_value = \ sp_projects mock_k2k.return_value.get_access.return_value = \ self.sp_data.unscoped_access_info mock_k2k.return_value.auth_url = \ 'http://service_provider_endp/identity/v3' mock_password.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, password=self.data.user.password, username=self.data.user.name, user_domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, unscoped=True, ), mock.call().__bool__(), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), ]) mock_client.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_password.return_value, ), mock.call().projects.list(user=user.id), mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_token.return_value, ), mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_token.return_value, ), mock.call().projects.list(user=user.id), mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_token.return_value, ), mock.call().auth.domains(), mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_token.return_value, ), mock.call().federation.projects.list(), mock.call( session=IsA(session.Session), auth=mock_token.return_value, ), ]) mock_token.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=self.data.project_one.id, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=None, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().__bool__(), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=self.data.project_one.id, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), mock.call().__bool__(), mock.call().get_sp_auth_url(IsA(session.Session), target_provider), mock.call( auth_url='http://service_provider_endp/identity/v3', token=self.sp_data.federated_unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=None, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().__bool__(), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.sp_data.federated_unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=self.sp_data.project_one.id, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(IsA(session.Session)), ]) mock_k2k.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( base_plugin=mock_token.return_value, service_provider=target_provider, ), We're going to break this up so it's some bit readable.

self.addCleanup(self.mox.UnsetStubs) if self.USE_MOX: self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(token_endpoint, 'Token') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Token') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Password') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(client_v3, 'Client') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Keystone2Keystone') class OpenStackAuthTestsV3(OpenStackAuthTestsV3Base): class OpenStackAuthTestsV3WithMock2(OpenStackAuthTestsV3Base): USE_MOX = False @mock.patch.object(client_v3, 'Client') @mock.patch.object(v3_auth, 'Token') @mock.patch.object(v3_auth, 'Password') def test_switch_keystone_provider_local_fail( self, mock_password, mock_token, mock_client ): mock_password.return_value.get_access.return_value = \ self.data.unscoped_access_info mock_password.return_value.auth_url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL mock_token.return_value.get_access.side_effect = [ self.data.domain_scoped_access_info, self.data.unscoped_access_info, keystone_exceptions.AuthorizationFailure, ] mock_client.return_value.projects.list.return_value = projects mock_password.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, password=self.data.user.password, username=self.data.user.name, user_domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, unscoped=True, ), mock.call().__bool__(), mock.call().get_access(mock.ANY), ]) mock_client.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( auth=mock_password.return_value, session=mock.ANY, ), mock.call().projects.list(user=user.id), mock.call( auth=mock_token.return_value, session=mock.ANY, ), ]) mock_token.assert_has_calls([ mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(mock.ANY), mock.call( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, project_id=self.data.project_one.id, reauthenticate=False, ), mock.call().get_access(mock.ANY), mock.call( auth_url=auth_url, token=unscoped.auth_token, project_id=None, reauthenticate=False, ), ])
deleted_lines: class OpenStackAuthTestsV3(OpenStackAuthTestsMixin, test.TestCase): super(OpenStackAuthTestsV3, self).setUp() self.mox = mox.Mox() self.addCleanup(self.mox.VerifyAll) self.addCleanup(self.mox.UnsetStubs) self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(token_endpoint, 'Token') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Token') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Password') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(client_v3, 'Client') self.mox.StubOutClassWithMocks(v3_auth, 'Keystone2Keystone') def test_switch_keystone_provider_local_fail(self): plugin = v3_auth.Password( auth_url=settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL, password=self.data.user.password, username=self.data.user.name, user_domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, unscoped=True) plugin.get_access(mox.IsA(session.Session)). \ AndReturn(self.data.unscoped_access_info) plugin.auth_url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL client = self.ks_client_module.Client( session=mox.IsA(session.Session), auth=plugin) url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL plugin = v3_auth.Token( auth_url=url, token=self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token, domain_name=DEFAULT_DOMAIN, reauthenticate=False) plugin.get_access(mox.IsA(session.Session)).AndReturn( self.data.domain_scoped_access_info) # if no projects or no enabled projects for user, but domain scoped # token client auth gets set to domain scoped auth otherwise it's set # to the project scoped auth and that happens in a different mock enabled_projects = [project for project in projects if project.enabled] if not enabled_projects: self.ks_client_module.Client( session=mox.IsA(session.Session), auth=plugin) client.projects = self.mox.CreateMockAnything() client.projects.list(user=user.id).AndReturn(projects) url = settings.OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL token = self.data.unscoped_access_info.auth_token plugin = v3_auth.Token( auth_url=url, token=token, project_id=self.data.project_one.id, reauthenticate=False) self.scoped_token_auth = plugin plugin.get_access(mox.IsA(session.Session)).AndReturn(unscoped) self.ks_client_module.Client( session=mox.IsA(session.Session), auth=plugin) # Let using the base token for logging in fail plugin = v3_auth.Token(auth_url=auth_url, token=unscoped.auth_token, project_id=None, reauthenticate=False) plugin.get_access(mox.IsA(session.Session)). \ AndRaise(keystone_exceptions.AuthorizationFailure) plugin.auth_url = auth_url self.mox.ReplayAll()

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[designate] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: If893e5c22d8c2f2f86ca6a472e74b457205ee2d8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Trigger ceph-ansible on ceph_systemd tag too

During fast forward upgrade we need a special step to migrate the
ceph systemd units to use podman, via ceph-ansible playbook.

This is triggered using --tags ceph_systemd so we want the ceph
tasks to run on that tag too.

Change-Id: I029903904550e789da731d83427bbcb7c6841c89
Closes-Bug: 1866339

commit_message:
Make sure -em tag is on last release

We don't want to allow tagging EM if there were no releases. We also
want to make sure the -em tag is on the last official release that was
done.

Change-Id: I7afb3a52cf2ec47d8e0154b51825b500806aa590
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add "closed" release cycles

Newton is EOL, and Ocata through Pike are in Extended Maintenance,
meaning they are closed as far as release management goes. This adds
those series to the list of closed cycles.

Change-Id: I3f3c3d61f40c951388f3a56e93bd23edd75f3276
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-atttach-inerfaces policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-attach-interfaces API policies.
- GET rules are made granular and default to System or project reader
- Other policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic405544560ae75ad88c10b8ff6d5048b3728cd2b

commit_message:
Ensure source service is up before resizing/migrating

If the source compute service is down when a resize or
cold migrate is initiated the prep_resize cast from the
selected destination compute service to the source will
fail/hang. The API can validate the source compute service
is up or fail the operation with a 409 response if the
source service is down. Note that a host status of
"MAINTENANCE" means the service is up but disabled by
an administrator which is OK for resize/cold migrate.

The solution here works the validation into the
check_instance_host decorator which surprisingly isn't
used in more places where the source host is involved
like reboot, rebuild, snapshot, etc. This change just
handles the resize method but is done in such a way that
the check_instance_host decorator could be applied to
those other methods and perform the is-up check as well.
The decorator is made backward compatible by default.

Note that Instance._save_services is added because during
resize the Instance is updated and the services field
is set but not actually changed, but Instance.save()
handles object fields differently so we need to implement
the no-op _save_services method to avoid a failure.

Conflicts:
    nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py
    nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py
    nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts as I8c96b337f32148f8f5899c9b87af331b1fa41424,
I711e56bcb4b72605253fa63be230a68e03e45b84,
I098f91d8c498e5a85266e193ad37c08aca4792b2 and
I19db48bd03855d1a1edbeff5adf15a28abcb5d92 are not in stable/train.

Change-Id: I85423c7bcacff3bc465c22686d0675529d211b59
Closes-Bug: #1856925
(cherry picked from commit ea2ea492a3d046d53d44039206fff69fe7e3ac61)

commit_message:
Fix os-keypairs pagination links

The API URL is '/os-keypairs', not '/keypairs'. Attempting to use these
pagination links as-is will result in a HTTP 404 (Not Found).

Change-Id: Ic04568caecc138e6016418f6878d031c4a0d3fb4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1866373

commit_message:
Fix hypervisors paginted collection_name.

Hypervisor view builder's _collection_name,
'hypervisors' is used to build next link that
sdk use as uri to do paginated query. But correct
API should be `GET /v2.1/os-hypervisors?<params>`
rather than `GET /v2.1/hypervisors?<params>`.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idc4f3fe54136a6bd3dbc7dc0efd3f62745991199
Closes-Bug: 1864428
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

commit_message:
zun: load container driver from entry point

Starting from U release, container driver is loaded from entry point.
Deployers should specify the entry point (i.e. ``docker``) in config
option ``container_driver`` under ``[DEFAULT]`` session.

Zun patch: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703259/

Change-Id: I96e38760e7b13a6e11737372e9e7fd36cca6f749
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/70/709370/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: container_driver = docker

subject: Don't validate token_flush for non-persistent token formats
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-26 15:57:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/b4b6e6d01ead2aaa5574836b428dce32b3a297f1', 'message': "WIP: Only validate token_flush for non-persistent tokens

THT incorporated a change so that the keystone_cron container deploys
only if a non-persistent token format is used:

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682265/

This is because `fernet` and `jws` tokens are completely non-persistent
by way of authenticated encryption and the keystone_cron container only
runs a cron job to execute `keystone-manage token_flush`, which prunes
expired tokens from keystone's token table. This cron job is useful for
deployments relying on `uuid`, `pki`, or some other out-of-tree provider
that requires tokens to be recorded for keystone's token validation
process.

This commit updates the validation to check for the token format and
only performs the validation if the token format isn't `fernet` or
`jws`.

commit_message:
Don't validate token_flush for non-persistent token formats

THT incorporated a change so that the keystone_cron container deploys
only if a persistent token format is used (e.g, `uuid`, `pki`):

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682265/

This is because `fernet` and `jws` tokens are completely non-persistent
by way of authenticated encryption and the keystone_cron container only
runs a cron job to execute `keystone-manage token_flush`, which prunes
expired tokens from keystone's token table. This cron job is useful for
deployments relying on `uuid`, `pki`, or some other out-of-tree provider
that requires tokens to be recorded for keystone's token validation
process.

This commit updates the validation to check for the token format and
only performs the validation if the token format isn't `fernet` or
`jws`.

Change-Id: Ib4d0a505021568975b79400d67fd709dd74e9acf

You should add '<desired interval> keystone-manage token_flush' to the keystone users crontab." when: "cron_result.stdout.find('keystone-manage token_flush') == -1" - name: Skip token flush validation debug: Skipping token flush validation since you're using a non-persistent token format. when: - ansible_facts['keystone::token_provider'] == 'fernet' or ansible_facts['keystone::token_provider'] == 'jws'

You should add '<desired interval> keystone-manage token_flush' to the keystone users crontab." when: "cron_result.stdout.find('keystone-manage token_flush') == -1"

commit_message:
Fix uwsgi groupname usage

There was an error where uwsgi services were launched
always with groupname = username, even when another
group was provided in uwsgi_services or set via
uwsgi_system_group_name.

Change-Id: Ifb4b026145849eb2c642d4c558d11f167548341e

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-deferred_delete policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-deferred_delete API policies.
This policy is default to PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I66f49e0ae7efaad791e6cd3194a959aed6945689

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-deferred_delete

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-deferred_delete API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I374876991c375d4765411204986e8fc2b0e08122
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/707476/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: BASE_POLICY_NAME, base.RULE_ADMIN_OR_OWNER, "Restore a soft deleted server or force delete a server before " "deferred cleanup", [ ])

commit_message:
Update limited connectivity guide for easy_install configuration

setup.py can sometimes use easy_install which requires different
configuration from pip to use a local index. This is necessary when
using a local pip mirror.

Change-Id: I60c01438aed4a3a6d3b867ee74bf13756fa831c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/66/711466/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In addition it is necessary to make configuration for easy_install which is used instead of pip to install anything listed under setup_requires in setup.py during wheel builds. See https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/reference/pip_install/#controlling-setup-requires To configure easy_install to use an alternative index, create the file `/root/.pydistutils.cfg` with the following content and ensure it is placed on the repo containers (or infra hosts in a metal deployment). .. code-block:: shell-session [easy_install] index_url = https://my.index-mirror.com that it needs to copy these files from the host into the container cache image. - /root/.pydistutils.cfg
deleted_lines: that it needs to copy that file from the host into the container cache image.

commit adds the appropriate configuration section to allow this to be

commit_message:
Added IPTables module support to Filebeat config

The IPtables module is currently absent in the filebeat config, meaning
that IPtables log data cannot be parsed into fields by filebeat. This
commit adds the appropriate configuration section to allow this to be
optionally enabled and configured with other iptables logfile locations.
The module is disabled by default, as filebeat will crash if the
appropriate log files are not found.

Change-Id: Ibd44234fd736d70e9e0bd5c4c6cab45f907c6d3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/81/710081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

Remove build_sphinx from setup.cfg, it's not used anymore since this
repo uses sphinx-build directly.

Require newer openstackdocstheme version and remove settings in conf.py
that are now default.

Remove doc/source/install/conf.py, it is not used anymore.

Change-Id: Id89c664384c3ad443d701f5d4135a9f3f9f744d7

commit_message:
Make package repo configurable

Make package repo (default rdo master) as ARG so it becomes
configurable during docker build, needed for offline or specific
version build.

Change-Id: I001dc69ec51b893070895e0fbb37aab8640e6fe4

commit_message:
Remove unrelated health check for sriov driver

Remove the ovs default bridge presence check from sriov health
checks. It is unrelated to sriov and adds overhead.
Additionally, derived from HealthHandler to staisfy base
driver requirement.

Change-Id: I8283c2931336250c0dc1f69e1e841c591fcf8cf5

commit_message:
ChunkedBackupDriver: Freeing memory on restore

When restoring many backups, the backup service uses a lot of memory and
when we do many concurrent restores the backup service ends up getting
killed becase the system runs out of memory.

This patch reduces the ref count to the data as soon as possible to let
Python garbage collect it instead of hogging it for the whole chunk
restore.

Related-Bug: #1865011
Change-Id: I942d9d8b3976232ae1cf82b698fb27285fbef13a
(cherry picked from commit 69462315bc8416bd02ebd6085f0cfc141cfd8877)

commit_message:
Delete VNF should fail with 409 error

If user deletes VNF in "PENDING_CREATE" status, VNF is deleted from
tacker but the resources created by VIM driver are not cleaned up
properly. This patch doesn't allow VNF to be deleted if the status is
in "PENDING_CREATE" status. It will raise 409 error.

APIImpact
Return 409 error instead of 200 when VNF is deleted in
"PENDING_CREATE" status.

Change-Id: I2de9c3dce5a4b3795119e2550aa8acea68940c45
Closes-Bug: #1798726

commit_message:
Fixes error handling if efibootmgr is not present in ramdisk

Python2.7 problem: FileNotFoundError is not defined, and it
will raise OSError exception instead. The code was adapted
to handle this case.

Change-Id: I8edff252e72cb91282f8984cd6935f39cd744cfe
Story: 2007324
Task: 38842
(cherry picked from commit 823a7cd9dbf93dc343021410dbab889ea1711ffb)

commit_message:
support virtual persistent memory

Virtual persistent memory has already been enabled in both QEMU and
libvirt. This spec seeks the support for virtual persistent memory
in OpenStack Nova.

Change-Id: I5f8479a4c5e9a2079f2e66389949fd6923009bfb
Implements: blueprint virtual-persistent-memory
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/96/601596/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== supporting virtual NVDIMM devices ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virtual-nvdimm Virtual non-volatile memory (or non-volatile dual in-line memory module 'NVDIMM') or in other words persistent memory devices have already been enabled in both QEMU and libvirt. This spec seeks the support for such devices in OpenStack Nova. The terms -- "NVDIMM" and "persistent memory" -- are used interchangeably in this spec. Problem description =================== For many years computer applications organized their data between two tiers: memory and storage. The emerging persistent memory technologies introduce a third tier. Persistent memory (or pmem for short) is accessed like volatile memory, using processor load and store instructions, but it retains its contents across power loss like storage. [1]_ Virtualization layer has already supported virtual NVDIMM (vNVDIMM) devices which means virtual machines now can have physical NVDIMM devices as the backend of virutal NVDIMM devices. As far as orchestration layer is concerned, several problems needs to be addressed: * How are the physical NVDIMM devices managed and presented as virtual NVDIMM devices * How are the vNVDIMM devices discovered and tracked as resources * How does the user specify the desired amount of vNVDIMM and other attributes * What is the life cycle of a vNVDIMM device Use Cases --------- Admin creates flavors with vNVDIMM devices by specifying the number of vNVDIMM devices, size of each vNVDIMM device and NUMA topology in flavor extra specs. End users select such flavors when creating VMs. The corresponding VMs are scheduled to hosts with sufficient resources. The vNVDIMM devices are visible to the guest OS and applications as physical NVDIMM devices and can be used thereafter. .. important :: This feature only works with libvirt driver. Proposed change =============== Background ---------- NVDIMM devices can be partitioned into namespaces which is the only way for software to use. There are two hardware working types of NVDIMM -- "persistent memory" (in short "pmem") and "block window" (in short "blk"). Each type can be further partitioned into namespaces in "raw", "sector", "fsdax" or "devdax" mode exclusively. [2]_ Though QEMU supports multiple types of vNVDIMM backends on Linux, currently the only one that can guarantee the guest write persistence is the device DAX on the real NVDIMM device (e.g., /dev/dax0.0), to which all guest access do not involve any host-side kernel cache. [3]_ Due to QEMU's preference on vNVDIMM backends, this spec only seeks the support of vNVDIMM devices backed by physical NVDIMM "persistent memory" (pmem) type namespaces and partitioned into "devdax" mode namespaces (e.g. /dev/daxX.Y). NVDIMM pmem type namespaces require contiguous physical space and are not managed in pages as ordinary system memory. This introduces a fragmentation issue with regard to multiple namespaces are created and used by multiple applications. As shown in below diagram, four applications are using four namespaces each of size 100GB:: +-----+ +-----+ +-----+ +-----+ |app1 | |app2 | |app3 | |app4 | +--+--+ +--+--+ +--+--+ +--+--+ | | | | | | | | +----v----+----v----+----v----+-----v---+ | | | | | | 100GB | 100GB | 100GB | 100GB | | | | | | +---------+---------+---------+---------+ After the termination of app2 and app4, it turns out to be:: +-----+ +-----+ |app1 | |app3 | +--+--+ +--+--+ | | | | +----v----+---------+----v----+---------+ | | | | | | 100GB | 100GB | 100GB | 100GB | | | | | | +---------+---------+---------+---------+ The total size of available space is 200GB. However a pmem namespace of 200GB size can not be created. NVDIMM Namespace Management --------------------------- Due to the aforementioned fragmentation issue, NVDIMM can not be managed in the similar way as system memory. In other words, dynamically creating and deleting NVDIMM namespaces upon VM creation and deletion will result in fragmentation and also a challenge to track NVDIMM resource. The proposed approach is to use admin pre-created namespaces. In other words, NVDIMM namespaces needs to be created during host provisioning and the absolute paths of the generated device nodes needs to be put into nova configuration file by cloud admins. Whether this is done manually or automatically by tools is out of the scope of Nova. However it is greatly encouraged to take fragmentation into considerations of admins when creating the NVDIMM namespaces. A new configuration option "nvdimm_namespaces" is introduced which is a list of strings to accommodate the NVDIMM namespace paths. Resource Tracking ----------------- Compute agent will report NVDIMM namespace resources to placement service. Eventually each NVDIMM namespace will be represented by a nested resource provider under NUMA resource provider. An example of resource providers topology of one compute node with 2 NUMA cells and each cell has 2 NVDIMM namespaces is as below diagram:: +--------------+ | | | compute node | | | +------+-------+ | +--------------+----------------+ | | | | +------+------+ +------+------+ | NUMA0 | | NUMA1 | +------+------+ +------+------+ | | | | +--------+-------+ +-------+--------+ | | | | +------+------+ +------+------+ +------+------+ +------+------+ | NVDIMM | | NVDIMM | | NVDIMM | | NVDIMM | | Namespace0 | | Namespace1 | | Namespace2 | | Namespace3 | +-------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ +-------------+ Since NUMA topology has not yet moved to placement [4]_, for the first phase resource providers for NVDIMM namespaces will be directly nested to the compute node ROOT resource provider. After the movement of NUMA to resource providers, the NVDIMM namespace resource providers will be nested to their corresponding NUMA cell resource providers. This also means that for the first phase, NUMA topology is not considered during scheduling even though vNVDIMM guest NUMA topology is specified. The resource class (RC) for NVDIMM devices are defined as "VNVDIMM_GB". Each NVDIMM namespace resource provider is consumed as a whole. So the values for "max_size", "min_size" and "total_size" of each NVDIMM namespace resource provider all equal to the real size of the physical NVDIMM namespace. Different NVDIMM namespaces can be of different sizes. Virtual NVDIMM guest NUMA topology ----------------------------------- Virtual NVDIMM information will be added to guest NUMA topology flavor extra specs in the form of:: hw:numa_nvdimm.[cell id].[nvdimm index] = [size by unit GB] Examples:: One NUMA node, one 512GB vNVDIMM: hw:numa_nodes = 1 hw:numa_nvdimm = 512 One NUMA node, two 512GB vNVDIMMs: hw:numa_nodes = 1 hw:numa_nvdimm.0.0 = 512 hw:numa_nvdimm.0.1 = 512 Two NUMA nodes, each node has one 512GB vNVDIMM: hw:numa_nodes = 2 hw:numa_nvdimm.0.0 = 512 hw:numa_nvdimm.1.0 = 512 Two NUMA nodes, each node has two 512GB vNVDIMMs: hw:numa_nodes=2 hw:numa_nvdimm.0.0 = 512 hw:numa_nvdimm.0.1 = 512 hw:numa_nvdimm.1.0 = 512 hw:numa_nvdimm.1.1 = 512 By matching guest NVDIMM NUMA topologies to host NUMA topologies, best scheduling decisions can be made to ensure least host cross NUMA accesses. Virtual NVDIMM Disposal ----------------------- Due to the persistent nature of host NVDIMM namespaces, the content of vNVDIMM in guest will be erased by default. Otherwise there will be security concerns. Since NVDIMM devices are typically of large size, this may introduce a performance penalty to guest deletion. A new configuration option "nvdimm_erase_namespaces" which is of Boolean type will be introduced with the default value of "True". When set to "False", the content in the host NVDIMM namespace will NOT be erased during guest deletion. Live Migration -------------- Live migration with vNVDIMM is supported by QEMU. This should be transparent to Nova. Virtual NVDIMM Hotplug ---------------------- This spec does not address the hot plugging of virtual NVDIMMs. Alternatives ------------ Admin can define a size of the NVDIMM namespaces for a certain host in the configuration file. Compute agent will create NVDIMM namespaces of that size on the host. This leave out the NVDIMM namespace creation burden from admin. However this limits one host of the same size NVDIMM namespaces. And also this approach will consume all the NVDIMM resources of the host leaving none for other purposes like storage caches. Data model impact ----------------- InstanceNUMACell object needs to be updated with:: InstanceNUMACell + 'nvdimms': obj_fields.ListOfIntegersField(nullable=True), + 'allocated_nvdimms': obj_fields.ListOfStringsField(nullable=True), Field 'nvdimms' is to track the number of vNVDIMM. Field 'allocated_nvdimms' is to track the host NVDIMM namespaces that the guest is using. REST API impact --------------- None. Flavor extra specs already accept arbitrary data. Security impact --------------- Host NVDIMM namespaces needs to be erased (zeroed) to be reused. This is the default behavior. However, we introduced a config option to bypass it if the cloud admin decides it will not be a security concern. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- End users choose flavors with desired vNVDIMM size and layout. Performance Impact ------------------ NVDIMMs tend to be large. Zeroing out a NVDIMM namespace requires a considerable amount of time. This may introduce a negative performance impact when deleting a guest with a large vNVDIMM. Other deployer impact --------------------- The deployer needs to pre-create the NVDIMM namespaces. Developer impact ---------------- None. Upgrade impact -------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: xuhj Other contributors: luyaozhong rui-zang Work Items ---------- * Enhance libvirt driver to report host NVDIMM namespaces to placement * Enhance libvirt driver with guest vNVDIMM life cycle management * Enhance libvirt driver to report NVDIMM NUMA affinity to placement after [4]_ being implemented Dependencies ============ NUMA topology is in the process of moving to placement. [4]_ It does not make sense to implement using legacy NUMA topology tracking approach for NVDIMM. Testing ======= Real hardware is not necessary since QEMU actually supports using files as the backend of virtual NVDIMM devices. Documentation Impact ==================== The cloud administrator docs need to describe the approach of creating NVDIMM namespaces and enroll them into nova configuration file. The end user needs to be make aware of this feature. References ========== .. [#] http://pmem.io/ .. [#] http://pmem.io/ndctl/ndctl-create-namespace.html .. [#] https://github.com/qemu/qemu/blob/19b599f7664b2ebfd0f405fb79c14dd241557452/docs/nvdimm.txt#L145 .. [#] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552924/ History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Stein - Introduced

subject: HostNotFound name->id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-25 09:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/objects/test_hosts.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/4dceebe201f6c25355ed36f1b7f1acc559fefd2c', 'message': "HostNotFound name->id

The msg format specified for HostNotFound exceptions uses the
key 'id' not 'name'. Correct usage in unit tests to ensure that

Change-Id: I793b51ff025b09d64fb0676cbe6947c85029893c
"}]
commit_message:
HostNotFound name->id

The msg format specified for HostNotFound exceptions uses the
key 'id' not 'name'. Correct usage in unit tests to ensure that
a KeyError is not raised during test execution.

Change-Id: I793b51ff025b09d64fb0676cbe6947c85029893c

subject: HypervisorNotFoundByName host_name->hypervisor_name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-02-25 09:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/ha/test_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/f116759a60a3eb9d6198198a4c712086dab58165', 'message': "HypervisorNotFoundByName host_name->hypervisor_name

commit_message:
HypervisorNotFoundByName host_name->hypervisor_name

The msg for HypervisorNotFoundByName uses the key 'hypervisor_name'
not 'host_name'.  Correct two test cases which incorrectly passed
host_name to avoid KeyErrors during test execution.

Change-Id: I29cebd31cd0481f15c1724d60cb8821db2da21cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/75/709675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
sonobuoy: fix conf.sonobuoy.Version to match real version

This value was left at the old v0.11.4, but Sonobuoy was updated to
v0.16.4 [1]. This doesn't seem to impact anything, but could cause
confusion.

1 - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695944/

Change-Id: Ifb230b55662ee5deadb91b6b7508f45773427401

subject: Remove duplicate helm chart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-05 05:01:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-addons/commit/6d76170e2be08ea7f645f621fd22d37950b77d60', 'message': 'Remove duplicate helm chart

There is a more recent kafka chart created in the OpenStack-Helm-Infra
repository that is better maintained -- with jobs in place. This patch
set removes a duplicate one in the OpenStack-Helm-Addon repository to
reduce the confusion.

commit_message:
Remove duplicate helm chart

There is a more recent kafka chart created in the OpenStack-Helm-Infra
repository that is better maintained -- with jobs in place. This patch
set removes a duplicate one in the OpenStack-Helm-Addon repository to
reduce the confusion.

Change-Id: Ic963152553dbda858bcafae2705d5167af568e9f
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Support set port vnic type to create server

When users create server use network uuid to provision the server instance
with a NIC. The type of vNIC default value is ``normal``, user can not set
it. This blueprint proposed to set port ``vnic_type`` when create a server.

APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Blueprint: boot-with-vnic-type
Change-Id: I0f737297dcb1c0cb7eed1f03e544e708b8762981
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/00/672400/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================================== Support set port vnic type to create server =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/boot-with-vnic-type When users create server use network uuid to provision the server instance with a NIC. The type of vNIC default value is ``normal``, user can not set it. This blueprint proposed to set port ``vnic_type`` when create a server. Problem description =================== When users want to use other type (not ``normal``, such as ``macvtap``, ``direct`` etc.) of port in creating a server. At first, we should create a specified type's port, then specify the created port to boot a server. In this way, we created a server in two steps. If we bulk create servers, this is impossible to achieve. In other words, if we need to create more than 10 servers, this will become very cumbersome make, it's very unfriendly to the user. Use Cases --------- As an user, I would like to boot a server with a ``direct`` or ``macvtap`` port, instead of being divided into multiple steps to achieve. Proposed change =============== Add a new microversion to the Create Server API. Add ``vnic_type`` to the Create Server API. Alternatives ------------ Create it in two steps, first create a port of type ``direct`` or ``macvtap``, then start the server with the created port. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- In a new microversion add the ``vnic_type`` flag to the API, it is optional: * URL: * /servers * Request method: * POST The ``vnic_type`` parameter will be able to add to the request payload :: { "server": { ... "networks": { ... "vnic_type": "direct" } } } Only show new parameters' JSON schema definition for body data of ``server`` :: 'vnic_type': parameter_types.vnic_type Depending on whether/how the ``vnic_type`` is set, the actions are as followed: - If ``vnic_type`` is supplied in the request body, at first Compute API will check whether the value provided is within the valid values. If not, a ``HTTP 400 Bad Request`` will be returned to users. - If ``vnic_type`` is not supplied in the request body, Compute API will pass it as ``None`` to Nova Compute. And Nova Compute will not pass ``vnic_type`` to neutron API when create port. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Update python-novaclient and python-openstackclient to support the new microversion. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: zhouhenglc Other contributors: zhangbailin, qinhaizhong Work Items ---------- * Add a new microversion for nova API. * Add ``vnic_type`` support in create server API. * Add ``vnic-type`` support for 'openstack server create' in openstackclient. * Add ``vnic-type`` support for 'nova boot' in novaclient. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add related unittest * Add related functional test * Add tempest tests Documentation Impact ==================== Add docs that mention the NIC and/or vnic type after the microversion. References ========== None History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Train - Introduced

commit_message:
Filter hypervisors by service host

The `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` API can list
hypervisors and the response contains the service host of the each
hypervisor. But there is no way to filter the returned hypervisors by the
host of the compute service that managing them. This feature would be
beneficial for Ironic users where a single compute host manages multiple
hypervisors. As well as for neutron to get the uuid of the hypervisor of
the non ironic compute host by filtering the hypervisors by the hostname
where the neutron agent is running.

APIImpact

blueprint: filter-hypervisors-by-service-host
Change-Id: I899fe2c55dc39094265a3f150841bd4e19ca4094
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/16/695716/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Filter hypervisors by service host ================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/filter-hypervisors-by-service-host The `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` API can list hypervisors and the response contains the service host of the each hypervisor. But there is no way to filter the returned hypervisors by the host of the compute service that managing them. This feature would be beneficial for Ironic users where a single compute host manages multiple hypervisors. As well as for neutron to get the uuid of the hypervisor of the non ironic compute host by filtering the hypervisors by the hostname where the neutron agent is running. Problem description =================== There is no way to filter the result of `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` API by the hostname of the compute service managing the hypervisor. Use Cases --------- As an ironic admin I want to list the ironic bare metal nodes handled by the given compute service. As a neutron developer I want to get the UUID of the hypervisor which is managed by a neutron agent running on a compute host without listing all the hypervisors in the system and filtering on neutron side. Proposed change =============== Support `service_host` filter of the `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` APIs. Alternatives ------------ Filter on the client side. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- In a new microversion add the new optional `service_host` query parameter to `GET /os-hypervisors` and `GET /os-hypervisors/details` APIs. If it is specified in the request then only those hypervisors are returned where the compute service hostname managing the hyperisor equals to the `service_host`. Specifying the existing `hypervisor_hostname_pattern` together with the new `service_host` query parameter is not supported and will result in HTTP 404. If compute service does not exists with the hostname specified in the `service_host` parameter of the request then HTTP 404 is returned. If a compute service exists with the hostname specified in the `service_host` parameter of the request but that compute service does not manage any hypervisors then HTTP 404 will be returned to be aligned with behavior of `hypervisor_hostname_pattern` query parameter. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Upgrade impact -------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: balazs-gibizer Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: balazs-gibizer Work Items ---------- * extend compute api to support querying compute host by service hostname * add a new microversion in which add `service_host` as a new optional query parameter of the os-hypervisor APIs. * add support for the new microversion in python-novaclient and openstackclient Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * functional API sample tests covering request and response validation * functional tests for covering actual filtering * unit test to cover error cases Documentation Impact ==================== * api samples and api-ref * release note References ========== * ML discussion that suggested the change http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/011044.html History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Ussuri - Introduced

commit_message:
Add pagination to Source table in Launch Instance wizard

The most elegant way to add pagination is to refactor the table using
<hz-dynamic-table> which already contains pagination instead of wiring
it to the existing table framework.
This solution adds the pagination and makes the code more readable.

Partial-Bug: #1859423

Change-Id: I08b7b94cf214a6b086565c2dd429e460e4e5c3de

commit_message:
[k8s] Support post install manifest URL

A new config option `post_install_manifest_url` is added to support
installing cloud provider/vendor specific manifest after booted
the k8s cluster. It's an URL pointing to the manifest file. For
example, cloud admin can set their specific storageclass into
this file, then it will be automatically setup after created
the cluster.

Task: 35798
Story: 2006209

Change-Id: Ib5a2c5cd7970085db941f189613e175f622aea3f

commit_message:
Start minimally using Open Edge environment

The new Open Edge provider, replacing Fortnebula, is likely ready
for workloads. Start with a maximum of one for each of its main and
custom pools to make sure things are working as expected before we
try to increase load there.

Change-Id: I5578881d52f56dfeb5c5254bfa417c90fa27ebe5

Ussuri contrib docs community goal

This patch standardizes the CONTRIBUTING.rst file and adds the
required doc/source/contributor/contributing.rst

Change-Id: Icee34784ede414890704a5bd8a4b56000df49e53

To start contributing to OpenStack, follow the steps in the contribution guide to set up and use Gerrit: https://docs.openstack.org/contributors/code-and-documentation/quick-start.html Bugs should be filed on Launchpad: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder For more specific information about contributing to this repository, see the cinder contributor guide: https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/contributing.html

Bugs should be filed on Launchpad, not in GitHub's issue tracker: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder

commit_message:
Fix multi-listener LB with missing certificate

This patch allows listeners on a load balancer to continue to
operate should one listener fail to access secret content in
barbican. Previously if one listener failed to access barbican
content, all of the listeners would be impacted.
This patch also cleans up some unused code and unnecessary comments.

Change-Id: I300839fe7cf88763e1e0b8c484029662beb64f0a
Story: 2006676
Task: 36951

commit_message:
Fix uncaught DB exception when trying to get a spare amphora

The MapLoadbalancerToAmphora task performs some database queries but
doesn't catch any exception from it.

In case something goes wrong with the database or the query, this commit
catchs any exception from the DB call, logs it and then returns None to
switch to the next decider branch (boot a new amphora).

Note: In Queens, string format method in the LOG.error call was changed
to please pep8/pylint.

Story 2007320
Task 38831

Change-Id: Ifb6c34426e0927534d332a8bbf2c66aac6c002c5

(cherry picked from commit e7376be7afec98192da969dc9382ad860b1cbe01)

subject: deployment: set DeployIdentifier to '' if --skip-deploy-identifier is used
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-03-05 13:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_deployment.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/deployment.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/7be309b48c433b061bdb0c528c90fe753b9f4cf0', 'message': "deployment: set DeployIdentifier to '' if --skip-deploy-identifier is used

DeployIdentifier needs to be empty if --skip-deploy-identifier is used
otherwise a new identifier is generated and the --skip-deploy-identifier
feature doesn't work, as Puppet and Ansible will be executed on all the
nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1866135
Change-Id: Ib1928b60ba7b03983f303577a53df078d32d2b1b
(cherry picked from commit e688d422fe8176e20bdf1b83e939ab067d3e5448)
"}]
commit_message:
deployment: set DeployIdentifier to '' if --skip-deploy-identifier is used

DeployIdentifier needs to be empty if --skip-deploy-identifier is used
otherwise a new identifier is generated and the --skip-deploy-identifier
feature doesn't work, as Puppet and Ansible will be executed on all the
nodes.

Closes-Bug: #1866135
Change-Id: Ib1928b60ba7b03983f303577a53df078d32d2b1b
(cherry picked from commit e688d422fe8176e20bdf1b83e939ab067d3e5448)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/54/711454/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: parameters['DeployIdentifier'] = ''

" msgid "Backing up a PVC" msgstr "Резервное копирование PVC" msgid "" "Backing up a PVC stored in Ceph, is fairly straigthforward, in this example " "we use the PVC ``mysql-data-mariadb-server-0`` as an example, but this will " "also apply to any other services using PVCs eg. RabbitMQ, Postgres." msgstr "" "Резервное копирование PVC, хранящегося в Ceph, достаточно просто. Ниже для " "примера приведён PVC ``mysql-data-mariadb-server-0``, но та же процедура " "подходит и для любых других сервисов, использующих PVC, таких как RabbitMQ " "или Postgres." msgid "" "Before proceeding, it is important to ensure that you have deployed a client " "key in the namespace you wish to fulfill ``PersistentVolumeClaims``. To " "verify that your deployment namespace has a client key:" msgstr "" "Перед тем, как продолжить далее, важно убедиться, что вы установили " "клиентский ключ в том пространстве имён, в котором вы собираетесь заполнять " "``PersistentVolumeClaims``. Выполните нижеприведённую команду для проверки " "того, что в этом пространстве имён есть клиеннтский ключ:" msgid "Bugs and Feature requests" msgstr "Сообщения об ошибках и запросы нового функционала" msgid "Ceph" msgstr "Ceph" msgid "Ceph Deployment Status" msgstr "Статус развёртывания Ceph" msgid "Ceph Validating PVC Operation" msgstr "Проверка работы PVC Ceph" msgid "Ceph Validating StorageClass" msgstr "Проверка StorageClass'а Ceph" msgid "Channels" msgstr "Чаты" msgid "Database Deployments" msgstr "Развёртывание баз данных" msgid "" "First, we want to validate that Ceph is working correctly. This can be done " "with the following Ceph command:" msgstr "" "В начале давайте проверим, что Ceph работоспособен. Это можно сделать с " "помощью следующей команды Ceph:" msgid "Galera Cluster" msgstr "Кластер Galera" msgid "Getting help" msgstr "Помощь" msgid "Installation" msgstr "Установка и развёртывание" msgid "" "Join us on `IRC <irc://chat.freenode.net:6697/openstack-helm>`_: #openstack-" "helm on freenode" msgstr "" "Присоединяйтесь к нам в `IRC <irc://chat.freenode.net:6697/openstack-" "helm>`_: #openstack-helm в сети freenode" msgid "Join us on `Slack <http://slack.k8s.io/>`_ - #openstack-helm" msgstr "" "Присоединяйтесь к нам в `Slack <http://slack.k8s.io/>`_ - #openstack-helm" msgid "" "Next we can look at the storage class, to make sure that it was created " "correctly:" msgstr "" "Далее мы можем посмотреть на класс хранилища, чтобы убедиться, что он создан " "корректно:" msgid "" "Note: This step is not relevant for PVCs within the same namespace Ceph was " "deployed." msgstr "" "Важно: Этот шаг не имеет отношения к PVC в тех же пространствах имён, в " "которых развёрнут Ceph." msgid "Once this has been done the workload can be restarted." msgstr "После вполнения процедуры рабочая нагрузка может быть перезапущена." msgid "PVC Preliminary Validation" msgstr "Предварительная проверка PVC" msgid "Persistent Storage" msgstr "Постоянное хранилище" msgid "" "Restoring is just as straightforward. Once the workload consuming the device " "has been stopped, and the raw RBD device removed the following will import " "the back up and create a device:" msgstr "" "Восстановление - так же достаточно простая процедура. Как только рабочая " "нагрузка использующая устройство остановлена, и отключено устройство с " "сырыми данными RBD, нижеприведённая процедура импортирует резерную копию и " "создаст устройство." msgid "" "Sometimes things go wrong. These guides will help you solve many common " "issues with the following:" msgstr "" "Иногда что-то идёт не так. Эти руководства помогут вам разрешить многие из " "типичных проблем:" msgid "" "The parameters are what we're looking for here. If we see parameters passed " "to the StorageClass correctly, we will see the ``ceph-mon.ceph.svc.cluster." "local:6789`` hostname/port, things like ``userid``, and appropriate secrets " "used for volume claims." msgstr "" "Здесь мы должны обратить внимание на параметры. Если они корректно преданы " "StorageClass'у, то мы увидим имя хоста/порт как ``ceph-mon.ceph.svc.cluster." "local:6789``, а так же ``userid``, и соответствующие секреты, использующиеся " "для запроса томов хранилищ." msgid "" "This guide is to help users debug any general storage issues when deploying " "Charts in this repository." msgstr "" "Это руководство предназначается для помощи пользователям в поиске и " "исправлении типичных ошибок в подсистеме хранения данных при развёртывании " "Chart'ов этого репозитория." msgid "" "This guide is to help users debug any general storage issues when deploying " "charts in this repository." msgstr "" "Это руководство предназначается для помощи пользователям в поиске и " "исправлении типичных ошибок в подсистеме хранения данных при развёртывании " "Chart'ов этого репозитория." msgid "" "To deploy the HWE kernel, prior to deploying Kubernetes and OpenStack-Helm " "the following commands should be run on each node:" msgstr "" "Для развёртывания HWE ядра перед установкой Kubernetes и OpenStack-Helm, " "команды, приведённые ниже, должны быть выполнены на каждом узле:" msgid "" "To make use of CephFS in Ubuntu the HWE Kernel is required, until the issue " "described `here <https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/external-storage/" "issues/345>`_ is fixed." msgstr "" "До исправления проблемы, описанной `здесь <https://github.com/kubernetes-" "incubator/external-storage/issues/345>`_, для использования CephFS в Ubuntu " "требуется использовать HWE ядро." msgid "To test MariaDB, do the following:" msgstr "Выполните эти команды для тестирования MariaDB:" msgid "" "To validate persistent volume claim (PVC) creation, we've placed a test " "manifest `here <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/openstack-helm/" "master/tests/pvc-test.yaml>`_. Deploy this manifest and verify the job " "completes successfully." msgstr "" "Для проверки создания требования постоянного хранилища (PVC) мы " "`опубликовали <https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openstack/openstack-helm/" "master/tests/pvc-test.yaml>`_ тестовый манифест. Разверните его, и " "убедитесь, что задание успешно завершается." msgid "Troubleshooting" msgstr "Поиск и устранение неполадок" msgid "Ubuntu HWE Kernel" msgstr "HWE ядро Ubuntu" msgid "" "Use one of your Ceph Monitors to check the status of the cluster. A couple " "of things to note above; our health is `HEALTH\_OK`, we have 3 mons, we've " "established a quorum, and we can see that all of our OSDs are up and in the " "OSD map." msgstr "" "Для проверки статуса кластера, воспользуйтесь одним из мониторов Ceph. " "Некоторые замечания: статус здоровья - `HEALTH\_OK`, у нас 3 монитора, " "установлен кворум, а так же мы можем видеть, что все наши OSD работоспособны " "и присутствуют в карте OSD." msgid "" "When discovering a new bug, please report a bug in `Storyboard <https://" "storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/886>`_." msgstr "" "Если вы столкнулись с новой ошибкой в программном обеспечении, сообщите о " "ней в `Storyboard <https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/project/886>`_." msgid "" "Without this, your RBD-backed PVCs will never reach the ``Bound`` state. " "For more information, see how to `activate namespace for ceph <../install/" "multinode.html#activating-control-plane-namespace-for-ceph>`_." msgstr "" "Без этого ваш PVC с RBD бэкэндом никогда не достигнет состояния ``Bound`` " "(Подключен). За более подробной информацией обратитесь к разделу `активация " "пространства имён Ceph <../install/multinode.html#activating-control-plane-" "namespace-for-ceph>`_."
