commit_message:
VNF LCM API based on ETSI NFV-SOL specification

Introduce new VNF Lifecycle and REST API endpoints for
VNF management instead of existing ones.

Blueprint: support-etsi-nfv-specs

Change-Id: I0ad50d3ada4237cdf7771559a5332195314ad5b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/66/591866/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================================== REST API for VNF based on ETSI NFV-SOL specification ==================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/support-etsi-nfv-specs ETSI specifications within the NFV Architecture Framework [#first]_ describe the main aspects of NFV development and usage based on of the industry needs, feedback from SDN/NFV vendors and telecom operators. These specifications include the REST API and data model architecture which is used by NFV users and developers in related products. Problem description =================== At the moment, Taker uses its own API, which describes CRUD operations with components based on ETSI NFV MANO standards. However, these operations are not aligned with the current ETSI NFV data-model. As a result there might be lack of compatibility with 3rd party VNFs, as they are developed according to ETSI NFV specifications. In addition, the mismatch with the generally accepted specifications brings additional complexity for integrations with 3rd party ETSI-compliant systems and increase time and efforts for brownfield deployments. ETSI NVF specifications describe not just internal logic of MANO, but also interactions with 3rd party systems as VIM, SDN Controllers, VNFs, EMSs and OSS and are actively used by multiple vendors in the market. Support of key ETSI NFV specifications will significantly reduce efforts for Taker integration into Telecom production networks and also will simplify further development and support of future standards. Proposed change =============== Introduce new VNF Lifecycle and REST API endpoints for VNF management instead of existing ones. [#second]_ To support standard VNF Lifecycle management operations and related APIs, first we should create a VNF instance resource to have a possibility to deploy it in future. VNF instance will be created in NOT_INSTANTIATE state. Flow of the creation of a VNF instance resource is: .. seqdiag:: seqdiag { Consumer -> VNFM [label = "1. POST .../vnf_instances"]; VNFM -->> VNFM [label = "2. Create VNF instance resource"]; Consumer <- VNFM [label = "3. 201 Created"]; } For deleting of the VNF Instance resource we will use the same sequence. Next step is performing tasks resources for the created instance, such as instantiation, scaling, healing and etc. General flow of VNF lifecycle management operations is: .. seqdiag:: seqdiag { Consumer -> VNFM [label = "1. POST .../vnf_instances{vnfInstanceId}/<<Task>>"]; VNFM -->> VNFM [label = "2. Create VNF LCM operation occurrence resource for this request"]; Consumer <- VNFM [label = "3. 202 Accepted"]; Consumer -> VNFM [label = "4. GET .../vnf_lcm_op_occs/{vnfLcmOpOccId}", rightnote = "Get current status of the operation"]; Consumer <- VNFM [label = "5. 200 OK (VnfmLcmOpOcc:operationState=PROCESSING)"]; VNFM -->> VNFM [label = "6. <<Operation>> finished"]; Consumer -> VNFM [label = "7. GET .../vnf_lcm_op_occs/{vnfLcmOpOccId}", rightnote = "Get current status of the operation"]; Consumer <- VNFM [label = "8. 200 OK (VnfmLcmOpOcc:operationState=COMPLETED)"]; } Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- TBD Will be described after creating model of VnfInstance REST API impact --------------- The following endpoints should be added: * | **Name**: List VNF Instances | **Description**: Request to list all existing VNF instances | **Method type**: GET | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+========================================================================+ | VnfInstance | 0..N | 200 OK | Information about zero or more VNF instances was queried successfully. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Create VNF Instance | **Description**: Creates a new VNF instance resource | **Method type**: POST | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances | **Request**: +------------------------+------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Attribute name | Data type | Cardinality | Description | +========================+============+=============+===================================================================================+ | vnfdId | Identifier | 1 | Identifier that identifies the VNFD which defines the VNF instance to be created. | +------------------------+------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | vnfInstanceName | String | 0..1 | Human-readable name of the VNF instance to be created. | +------------------------+------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | vnfInstanceDescription | String | 0..1 | Human-readable description of the VNF instance to be created. | +------------------------+------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+=====================================================+ | VnfInstance | 1 | 201 Created | A VNF Instance identifier was created successfully. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Get VNF Instance | **Description**: Request to existing VNF instance resource by its id | **Method type**: GET | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId} | **Resource URI variables for this resource**: +---------------+---------------------------------+ | Name | Description | +===============+=================================+ | vnfInstanceId | Identifier of the VNF instance. | +---------------+---------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+========================================================================+ | VnfInstance | 1 | 200 OK | Information about an individual VNF instance was queried successfully. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Delete VNF Instance | **Description**: Request to delete VNF instance resource by its id | **Method type**: DELETE | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId} | **Resource URI variables for this resource**: +---------------+---------------------------------+ | Name | Description | +===============+=================================+ | vnfInstanceId | Identifier of the VNF instance. | +---------------+---------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+========================================================================================+ | n/a | | 204 No Content | The VNF instance resource and the associated VNF identifier were deleted successfully. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Instantiate VNF task | **Description**: This task resource represents the "Instantiate VNF" operation. The client can use this resource to instantiate a VNF instance. | **Method type**: POST | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId}/instantiate | **Resource URI variables for this resource**: +---------------+--------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Definition | +===============+========================================================+ | vnfInstanceId | The identifier of the VNF instance to be instantiated. | +---------------+--------------------------------------------------------+ | **Request**: +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Attribute name | Data type | Cardinality | Description | +======================+====================+=============+====================================================================================================+ | flavourId | IdentifierInVnfd | 1 | Identifier of the VNF deployment flavour to be instantiated. | +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | instantiationLevelId | IdentifierInVnfd | 0..1 | Identifier of the instantiation level of the deployment flavour to be instantiated. | | | | | If not present, the default instantiation level as declared in the VNFD is instantiated. | +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | extVirtualLinks | ExtVirtualLinkData | 0..N | Information about external VLs to connect the VNF to. | +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | vimConnectionInfo | VimConnectionInfo | 0..N | Information about VIM connections to be used for managing the resources for the VNF instance. | +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | additionalParams | KeyValuePairs | 0..1 | Additional input parameters for the instantiation process, specific to the VNF being instantiated. | +----------------------+--------------------+-------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+=====================================================================================+ | n/a | | 202 Accepted | The request was accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Terminate VNF task | **Description**: This task resource represents the "Terminate VNF" operation. The client can use this resource to terminate a VNF instance. | **Method type**: POST | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId}/terminate | **Resource URI variables for this resource**: +---------------+------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Description | +===============+======================================================+ | vnfInstanceId | The identifier of the VNF instance to be terminated. | +---------------+------------------------------------------------------+ | **Request**: +------------------+----------------+-----------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Attribute name | Data type | Possible values | Cardinality | Description | +==================+================+=================+=============+=========================================================================================+ | terminationType | Enum (inlined) | FORCEFUL | 1 | Indicates whether forceful or graceful termination is requested. | | | | | | At first, only forceful termination will be supported. | +------------------+----------------+-----------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | additionalParams | KeyValuePairs | | 0..1 | Additional parameters to the termination process, specific to the VNF being terminated. | +------------------+----------------+-----------------+-------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+=====================================================================================+ | n/a | | 202 Accepted | The request was accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ * | **Name**: Individual VNF LCM operation occurrence | **Description**: Resource to read status information about an individual VNF lifecycle management operation occurrence. | **Method type**: GET | **URL for the resource**: /vnflcm/v1/vnf_lcm_op_occs/{vnfLcmOpOccId} | **Resource URI variables for this resource**: +---------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | Name | Description | +===============+================================================================+ | vnfLcmOpOccId | Identifier of a VNF lifecycle management operation occurrence. | +---------------+----------------------------------------------------------------+ | **Response**: +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Data type | Cardinality | Response Codes | Description | +=============+=============+================+=========================================================================+ | VnfLcmOpOcc | 1 | 200 OK | Information about a VNF LCM operation occurrence was read successfully. | +-------------+-------------+----------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+ Data types (will be describes soon): * VnfInstance * VnfLcmOpOcc * ExtVirtualLinkData * VimConnectionInfo Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- TBD VNF Lifecycle Management includes subscriptions from VNFM to NFVO, as these functional blocks in ETSI are described as separate applications, however, if Tacker sends and listens to notifications from itself, it would be a strange behaviour. Other end user impact --------------------- TBD Python-tackerclient should be changed to use the new API, but maybe it is possible to leave the existing cli commands (depend on possibility to terminate existing VNF via new API) Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- TBD Backward compatibility terms should be discussed. We should add possibility to get all instances created by the current API through the new API and vice versa. A VNF which was deployed via an old API should be terminated only via an old API. However, old methods should be marked as deprecated and soon removed. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Aliaksandr Hrechny <grechny.alexander@gmail.com> Other contributors: Andrey Sviridov <andrey.s.sviridov@gmail.com> Aleksei Kozhevnikov <Magistrazh@gmail.com> Bernard Tsai <Bernard.Tsai@telekom.de> Work Items ---------- * Implement new API in Tacker-server. * Implement backward compatibility between API versions. * Make changes in Heat-translator to add extra output parameters for a VNF Instance. * Change Python-tackerclient for using the new Tacker-server API. * Prepare new Unit Tests. * Implement Functional Tests. * Change API Tacker documentation. Dependencies ============ None References ========== .. [#first] https://www.etsi.org/technologies-clusters/technologies/NFV .. [#second] https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/003/02.04.01_60/gs_nfv-sol003v020401p.pdf (Chapter 5: VNF Lifecycle Management interface)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

openstack-ansible repos need few updates on requirements
and tox file.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711015/
Change-Id: I49e749724b4e4b7c2cb7eab188bc676a86a47ee1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build refs/changes/94/710594/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Verify version number for virtualenv>=20.0.0

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/711015
Change-Id: Ibc92a6126ff161e1f2edd5d831a1f832d328323e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build refs/changes/80/707480/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # _virtualenv_version may take two forms: # '15.1.0' # 'virtualenv 20.0.1 from /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/virtualenv/__init__.pyc' - name: Extract just the virtualevn version number set_fact: _virtualenv_version_number: "{{ (_virtualenv_version.stdout.split(' ') | length == 1) | ternary(_virtualenv_version.stdout, _virtualenv_version.stdout.split(' ')[1] }}" {{ _virtualenv_version_number }} is installed. when: - ((_virtualenv_version_number | trim) == 'none') or ((_virtualenv_version_number | trim) is version('1.10', '<')) {{ ((_virtualenv_version_number | trim) is version('14.0.0', '<')) | ternary('--never-download', '--no-download') }} {{ ((_virtualenv_version_number | trim) is version('1.7.0', '<')) | ternary('--no-site-packages', '') }}
deleted_lines: {{ _virtualenv_version.stdout }} is installed. when: - ((_virtualenv_version.stdout | trim) == 'none') or ((_virtualenv_version.stdout | trim) is version('1.10', '<')) {{ ((_virtualenv_version.stdout | trim) is version('14.0.0', '<')) | ternary('--never-download', '--no-download') }} {{ ((_virtualenv_version.stdout | trim) is version('1.7.0', '<')) | ternary('--no-site-packages', '') }}

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

magnum-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I58baf3f7361468de98fc43a1aed036af9c4e5051

commit_message:
Add functional tests

These add some coverage to functionality not covered by the regular
unit tests, but I think they can't be run in the gate because they
use sudo.

Change-Id: Ic62c95b83f68f94328deb00227b7eabf249ce898

commit_message:
Remove dogpile kwarg test

This test is verifying dogpile behavior[0], not oslo.cache behavior.
Since dogpile has broken this behavior, we are now broken with no
real way to fix it on our end. We should leave dogpile testing to
dogpile and only run unit tests that test our code.

0: The ValueError we are asserting on comes from dogpile.cache:
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/blob/1b4ab2d3e08b9fe606bf723299f815207dacceaa/dogpile/cache/util.py#L35

Change-Id: I5ff1bd473167b84f64312efb659e26230605b480

commit_message:
Optionally configure Ceph RGW listener with SSL

In order to have ssl for the ceph rgw component, this
review adds the steps needed to generate the key/cert
if the related condition is true.
This patch also adds all the elements to make the cert
request using tls-e framework.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/703743
Co-Authored-By: Francesco Pantano <fpantano@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I85b855fdf2bd14f497862bddf46b0f205058d7d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/91/666291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnableInternalTLS: type: boolean default: false conditions: internal_tls_enabled: {equals: [{get_param: EnableInternalTLS}, true]} if: - internal_tls_enabled - radosgw_civetweb_ssl_certificate=/etc/pki/tls/certs/rgw_in_pem_format - ''

subject: Introduce scope_types in os-admin-password
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-01-08 21:52:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ea546b5c6ff3ae2668488d94c9376863f0554e88', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in os-admin-password

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-admin-password API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-admin-password

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-admin-password API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I859dca0acdd76fa385014bc96b2f24df522be4f4

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-console-output policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-admin-password API policies.

This policy is default to owner or system admin role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Icadf5e1a05a93ad1524b2c519f1cc56a65156d8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/707041/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: check_str=base.PROJECT_MEMBER_OR_SYSTEM_ADMIN,

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-volumes-attachments policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
  - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
  - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
  - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-volumes-attachments API policy.

Change-Id: Ibe7aaef25c7eccf2ce017fc606aae9a1448d8bcb

commit_message:
Zookeeper backend SSL support

Bump kazoo version to 2.6.0 that supports SSL.

Allow to configure ssl config options via conf
* keyfile
* keyfile_password
* certfile
* use_ssl
* verify_certs

https://kazoo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/client.html#kazoo.client.KazooClient

This should be done in conformance with Redis
jobboard backend, that already allows SSL settings.

Change-Id: Ic2670c3c4caa93f69bc2d541c3701df2b6037d2e

'test_compatibility_routines' fixture to sanity check object versioning
and we don't do things like remove objects that are referenced

commit_message:
Handle unregistered nested objects

The 'obj_tree_get_versions' function is used by e.g. the
'test_compatibility_routines' fixture to sanity check object versioning
and we don't do things like remove objects that are referenced
elsewhere. Unfortunately if we do this exact thing, an unhelpful
'IndexError' is raised. Handle things better and raise a specific
exception with hints towards what may be the root cause.

Change-Id: I7c05c648a9efb018ef9718fa31a9cc075482db59
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1860652

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-console-output

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-console-output API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If9d7fafa7d49b49879b6f1b27a62292ab522c4d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/707040/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: It defines the set of context with scopped token

commit_message:
Add bindep file

We're missing one of these, which means starting from a bare node
it's not completely possible to install openstackclient based only
on bindep and pip. Add one that allows building and installing.

Change-Id: I7b297bb1485773df3d5d1cc3ba78b0b9af4b2d00

commit_message:
Add agent_token api version history update

The original agent token addition patch did not
update the webapi history file. This patch updates
the file separately as not to negatively impact
patches based upon that patch with-in CI.

Change-Id: Ic71782c9af652b259caaf43089e975e41392ec65

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-instance-action policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
  - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
  - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
  - https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-instance-action API policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh
Change-Id: If2d878177c65c9fd6ff44c9b20c354b26d583f40

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-create-backup

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-create-backup API policies
as 'system' and 'project'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I0d526bfffe44b59a75d46e7377e705447a349b04
